content: Which planet in our solar system is known for its striking red color and is often called the "Red Planet"?

Ah, that would be Mars! It's fascinating how it got its nickname. The reddish appearance is due to the iron oxide, or rust, on its surface. I've always been intrigued by Mars because of its potential for supporting life. There's so much exploration happening there with rovers like Perseverance and Curiosity sending back amazing data. It's like a whole new world right in our backyard!
